Job Title: Zomi - Burmese Translator

Location: Tulsa, OK

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Position Overview

Navistar is currently looking for a Zomi-Burmese Translator. You will be responsible for listening to, understanding, and translating spoken or written statements from one language to another. Reproduce statements in another language for listening and/or reading audience. This position is not for interpretation, only translation.

Schedule: Monday through Thursday 5:00 AM to 3:30PM, some overtime required.

Responsibilities

Additional responsibilities include:

 Facilitate effective communication between two parties that do not speak a similar language by converting one spoken or written language to another. Attend conferences and meetings and act as official translator to mediate discussion. Relay concepts and ideas between languages. Convert written materials from one language into another, such as newsletter, hot news, work instructions, and other Company related forms. Edit and proofread text to accurately reflect language. Receive and submit assignments electronically. Use dictionaries and glossaries for reference. Employ computer-assisted translation when needed Facilitate communication for people with limited English proficiency. Translate languages at meetings such as New Hire Orientation, Stand-up morning meetings, and SWE’s. Read aloud documents in a language other than that in which they were written. Adapt a product or service for use in a different language and culture. Typing, use of Microsoft suite Other clerical duties as required

Minimum Requirements

At least 1 year plant manufacturing experienceAt least 3 months quality experience

Additional Requirements

Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status)Understanding of ISO principlesAbility to walk/stand up to 10 hours per dayThis position is safety sensitive and may involve the operation of vehicles, operation of equipment, and/or involve work with power tools, or handling of hazardous materials, that could result in injury or damage to person/property/manufacturing process

Desired Skills

Positive attitude, ethics and International’s values which support our company’s values, and a healthy, high performance culture Strong Communication skills both written and oralSelf-motivated with ability to work under pressureAbility to review audits with all levels of the Assembly TeamComputer skills including Excel and WordHigh School Diploma or GED preferred

Company Overview

Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.

Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.

With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.

Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility

Visit us at www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization

Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

#ridewithnavistar

Experience Level (if available): None
